data.title: Strange Camera2d behavior
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows / Godot 2.1.3

**Issue description:**
Node structure:
root->node2d->[camera2d->sprite, button, WindowDialog, Panel]

Camera2d behaves strangely.    The camera limit is set to 0,0 as the top/left.  When the project is first started, the button and dialog appear in the expected areas.  But if the camera is translated(Vector2(1,0)) or translated(Vector2(0,1)), the button and dialog and panel (which are not children of the camera and thus should not be affected move even though the sprite does not.

Additionally, even though the camera does not appear to move outside of the limits, translate() is moving it anyway thus there is a margin created where translate() must be called in the opposite direction before it appears responsive once more.

Additionally, whilte the sprite itself settles at the expected position, there is observed jitter where it appears the camera translates outside of the limit for a brief period before the sprite is redrawn in the correct position.

Images of this in action: http://imgur.com/a/3sWqO Second image shows the expected positions in the editor.  First image shows the project play after using translate() to move the camera outside of the boundaries.

**Expected behavior:**
translate() respects the camera2d limits and siblings of the camera are not affected by the Camera2d's position.

data.title: Increased smooth scroll speed and added user setting
data.body:
Increased smooth scroll speed and added editor setting, also exposed to users.  

Should close #10489

data.title: added setting to override the theme background with editor theme color
data.body:
This adds a `bool` setting so that the code editor can chooses the `editor_theme dark_color_1` color as the background.
This is useful when using custom them colors and so that the code editor never looks alien to the rest.

data.title: Fix color_ramp indexing negative elements
data.body:
The 'pos' variable passed to get_color() and get_offset() can be
negative if the color ramp itself is empty. This causes a lookup in an
empty position in the color Vector which leads to a crash.

We add a check so we never do a lookup in the color Vector if the
gradient is empty.

This fixes #10501

data.title: Debugger fails on master -error code 3
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Win x64 bit
Godot 3.0 master (d8cd849)

**Issue description:**
Cannot run project from editor because debugger fails to connect.

In editor console:
 platform\windows\stream_peer_winsock.cpp:202 - Server disconnected!

The console behind the editor window is slightly more informative:
Remote Debugger: Connection failed with error status '3', retrying in 1 sec. x2
Remote Debugger: unable to connect
shit?:invalid argument

**Steps to reproduce:**
Try to run a project from editor.

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Adding/changing inputs for default actions does not save them.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu Linux 17.04 64-bit.
Godot 3.0 pull 1be30f3.

**Issue description:**
As detailed per #9472 - custom actions and their inputs can be added and saved. However, adding (or changing) default actions (for example ui_down) does not save them. They are added to the project until you quit out of it. The next time you enter the project they are not there, because they were not saved.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Add or change any input to any default action in the project settings "Input Map" tab.

data.title: Gradiant handles removal will crash Godot.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0 Master d8cd849 
Manjaro Linux 64-bit

**Issue description:**
A crash to desktop occured while editing gradiant on a Line2D. I suspect this issue is more gradiant centered than the Line2D node. Removing all gradiant handles by right-clicking will crash godot.


**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Add a Line2D Node
2. Add a gradiant under "Fill"
3. Right-click gradiant handles to delete then all
4. Crash occurs when all handles are removed from the gradiant editor.

data.title: ViewportTexture sampling artifacts
data.body:
there are already bugreports about ViewportTexture, but this one is more interesting.
i failed to sample ViewportTexture directly, because it returns 0 for every pixel. I think this is related with other issues. But when i assigned ViewportTexture to anothe Sprite on the scene, i was able to sample it. But with artifacts. This is when Viewport was set in 2d mode (which i assume is correct when it is used with Sprite node). But in 3d mode there aren't any artifacts.

Setting Viewport to unsahded does not fixes this issue. Only 3d mode does.

please have a look here https://github.com/curly-brace/Godot-Simplex
first screenshot demonstrates what artifacts look like. compare the image on the sprite in the corner, with actual values returned by get_pixel and value applied as Y coord of a tile. there are some sort of steps (like on light artifacts or shadows)
scene named 'test_3d', set Viewport mode to 2d and run the demo.
you can edit the script on the root node to set scale of noise (to see artifacts more clearly) and setup the script to update only once (there is a commented flag)

also. using sign() on the sampled value shows that some of them are even negative

data.title: ShortCut can be used only with InputEvents
data.body:
While working on the CanvasItemEditor, I figured out that a lot of keyboard "shortcuts" were hardcoded into the code, and thus could not be modified in the editor preferences. 

The problem is the following: the `ShortCut` node (scene/gui/input_action.h) has an` is_shortcut(const Ref<InputEvent> &p_event)` function to test whether or not an InputEvent corresponds to the recorded shortcut. However, there is no way to test is the keys in the shortcut are currently pressed or not (like with `Input::get_sigleton()->is_key_pressed()`), unless using something like in `spatial_editor_plugin.cpp`:
```
int key_left = ED_GET_SHORTCUT("spatial_editor/freelook_left")->get_shortcut()->cast_to<InputEventKey>()->get_scancode();
if (input.is_key_pressed(key_left)) {
...
}
```
The problem is that this code does not handle shortcuts with key modifiers (ctrl, alt, shift) :/. Also, shortcuts using mouse buttons instead of keyboards key would not work. 

I can see those two solutions to the problem:
- We implement a `is_pressed()` function in the ShortCut interface.
- We implement an `is_key_pressed_with_modifiers()` function in the `Input` interface

data.title: Shader language: incomplete swizzle support
data.body:
you can't make a vector larger then initial using swizzle (but should)

```glsl
vec2 test2 = vec2(0.0, 1.0);
vec3 test3 = text2.xxx; // ERROR
```

MacOS Sierra

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->

can not compile Godot engine.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Use scons platform=osx to compile, got these errors:

[ 86%] Compiling ==> core/global_defaults.cpp
core/global_defaults.cpp:1:10: fatal error: 'global_config.h' file not found
#include "global_config.h"
         ^
1 error generated.
scons: *** [core/global_defaults.osx.tools.64.o] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.

data.title: D Programming Language as Script Language.
data.body:
Hello, I am a Japanese user.
Do you know the D programming language?
You do not need to know. If you look at the site called https://dlang.org/, it will be easy to understand.
The basic syntax is the C language itself, but I am dealing with C++, Java, Python (which was the base of GDScript) and C# which I plan to support in 3.0.
The D language itself is a native compiler, but if you prepare a compiler infrastructure that is compatible with Godot's multi-platform (it is OK with LLVM-based LDCs), you can leave portability, Godot's strength, Let's see. What do you think?

data.title: Add stretching to `TextureProgress`
data.body:
Now `TextureProgress` has `stretch` flag. With this flag enabled,
it's being rendered as 9-path using `stretch_margin_*` properties
as texture margins.

Stretching doesn't support `FILL_CLOCKWISE` and `FILL_COUNTER_CLOCKWISE` fill modes.

data.title: Fixed segfault when hovering over tree elements and showing tooltips.
data.body:
Fixes #10372 

I'm still not sure why I have to add this null pointer check in this commit when it was done [above](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/10492/files#diff-b0e269beca0e7df95d035998c40ecb64R1446). For some reason after adding this check I'm not getting any segmentation fault.

data.title: Max floor angle as parameter on move_and_slide
data.body:
**Godot version: 2.1.4 beta 3**

**Issue description:**
`move_and_slide` was added on 2.1 but it has a fixed value for slopes to be considered floor (~45 degrees), making it as a parameter like on Godot 3 could be better for a more flexible floor and wall detection.

That floor angle affects ceiling detection too on 3, and the value is fixed on 2.1 too.

data.title: [v2.1] Correct hash behavior for floating point numbers
data.body:
This backports the work in #7815 and the subsequent fixes in #8393

The following program now works as expected in this branch in both
release_debug and debug mode:

```gdscript
        print(sqrt(-1))
        print(sqrt(-1))

        var simple1=asin(10.0)
        var simple2=acos(10.0)
        print(simple1)
        print(simple2)
```

And successfully prints -nan 4 times

This fixes #9580 and fixes #8925

data.title: Smooth scrolling in the script editor is too slow and not responsive enough
data.body:
The smooth scrolling that was recently added (and enabled) by default in the script editor is *way* too slow and makes it much harder to use; it seems to ignore mouse wheel events while scrolling (which is not instant when smooth scrolling is enabled), which can make scrolling feel less responsive as well (if you try scrolling in the opposite direction while it is scrolling, you might have to wait up to a second for it to react).

Also, if you scroll a lot in a short time frame (which is doable with mice having "freewheel" modes), it will keep scrolling for several seconds after you stopped the mouse wheel.

data.title: Visual Script Editor: property selector leaves behind empty node after canceling.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 - master branch

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
When you drag a link off an object instance into empty space and then select Get, Set, or Call, it will pop open the property selector. If you press cancel or close the property selector it will leave behind an empty node. Not sure if this is intentional behavior but what I would have expected is for the entire operation to be canceled and no node left over.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open a visual script
2. Open a function
3. Put an object instance somewhere on the graph
4. Drag the output of the node into an empty part of the graph then hit Call, Get, or Set
5. Hit cancel in the property selector

![godot-issue](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1817000/29497462-289fa72a-85b6-11e7-9138-3c6faca23d19.gif)

data.title: p_screen param from get_screen_* funcs now default to the current screen
data.body: With this PR, and a multi-monitor setup, the get_screen_* funcs get (by default) the position/size/dpi from the current screen, instead of getting (by default) the position/size/dpi from the first monitor.

data.title: Clear script does not work for manually duplicated scenes
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
macOS 10.12.6
Godot 3.0.alpha (build from 3bea3256f5def126b2b6d639ed70c4ddc3990344)

**Issue description:**
I wanted to duplicate a scene. I couldn't find a way to do it from the editor so I did it from the file manager. But then I couldn't replace or clear the script file for the new scene.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. I copied the .tscn file and gave it a new name. 
2. Then I opened it inside Godot and saw that the script attached was from the original scene. 
3. I wanted to clear the script and replace it with a new .gd file (for the new scene), so I pressed clear script button in the Scene panel. 
4. Nothing happened (script is still attached). There is no way right now that I can say it should use a new script instead of the one from the original scene. "Attach script" is not working either (just opens the existing script, from the original scene)

data.title: Ctrl + C inside the script editor should copy current line if there is no selection
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.3
Godot 3 (built from master)

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Ctrl + C only works if something is selected
Ctrl + C should work just like Ctrl + X, if there is no selection it should copy the whole line

**Steps to reproduce:**
Open a script file
go to any line that has something written
press Ctrl + C (without having text selected)
press Ctrl + V
see that the line was not copied to the clipboard

data.title: Fix deadlock in CommandQueueMT
data.body:
When we call push_and_ret functions from 9 threads (because of SYNC_SEMAPHORES = 8) we get deadlock in this part of code:

```
CommandRet0<T, M, R> *cmd = allocate_and_lock<CommandRet0<T, M, R> >(); //get queue mutex lock
...
SyncSemaphore *ss = _alloc_sync_sem(); //try to get sync semaphore. If all of them is not free, we sleep 1ms and try again and again
...
unlock(); //locked semaphores can't release until we get this line
```

data.title: Reduced default orbit sensitivity for smoother rotation
Fixed issues with borderless windows on Windows
data.body: Same as #9584 but for 2.1

data.title: Fixes Ref's GetTypeInfo missing with ptrcall disabled
Light emission on spatial materials works strange in Unshaded mode
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Arch linux - master branch

**Issue description:**
If Unshaded flag is set, light emission uses Albedo instead of Emission. And emission options does nothing in this case.
Without Unshaded flag all works as expected.

That can be reproduced if enable Glow effect on camera and set color values to more than 1.0 to have HDR effect.

If Unshaded mode assumes to not use Emission, maybe Emission group should be hidden.
